p: A hydroethanolic extract (50%) from Mesosphaerum suaveolens (syn. Hyptis suaveolens) was assessed trough the streptozotocin model in order to verify its antihyperglycemic activity. A significant reduction in the rat blood glucose was observed in diabetic animals treated with the extract. This finding could be attributed to the stimulating effects on glucose utilization and antioxidant enzymes ( Mishra et al., 2011). Using the same experimental model, Ogar et al. (2018) investigated the effect of ethanolic extract from the leaves of Condea verticillata (syn. Hyptis verticillata) and found interesting results such as significant decrease in body weight, increased fasting blood glucose and glycated hemoglobin levels, decreased pancreatic islet area and Î²-cell number, indicating an antihyperglycemic effect.
